title: Converter
instruction_text: Choose a category at the top (Length, Area, Weight, Time, Speed, Temperature, Volume, Energy, Pressure, or Currency). Enter a value, select the units for "from" and "to", and click "Convert" (all units except currency also update live while typing). Currency conversion uses live rates and won't load without an internet connection.
length_info_body:
Length units are based on the SI system. The base unit is the meter (m). Smaller units are millimeter (mm), centimeter (cm), and decimeter (dm). Larger units are kilometer (km).

Conversions are powers of ten: 1 m = 100 cm, 1 cm = 10 mm, 1 km = 1000 m. Converting to a larger unit makes the number smaller; converting to a smaller unit makes it larger.

  • Example: 1 m = 0.001 km
  • Example: 250 cm = 2.5 m
  • Tip: km -> m * 1000, m -> km / 1000
area_info_body:
Area is two-dimensional, so length units are squared: m2, cm2, km2. Squaring makes conversion factors larger than for length.

Key relations: 1 m2 = 10,000 cm2, 1 ha = 10,000 m2, 1 km2 = 1,000,000 m2. Hectares (ha) are often used in agriculture and forestry.

  • Example: 2 ha = 20,000 m2
  • Example: 0.5 km2 = 500,000 m2
  • Tip: km2 -> m2 * 1,000,000
weight_info_body:
In daily use people say "weight", but physically it is mass. The base unit is the kilogram (kg). Smaller units: gram (g), milligram (mg). Larger unit: tonne (t).

Conversions: 1 kg = 1000 g, 1 g = 1000 mg, 1 t = 1000 kg. So the factors are powers of ten again.

  • Example: 1.5 kg = 1500 g
  • Example: 250,000 mg = 250 g
  • Tip: t -> kg * 1000, kg -> g * 1000
time_info_body:
Time values convert through seconds. The second (s) is the base unit. Other units are milliseconds (ms), minutes (min), hours (h) and days (d).

Conversions: 1 min = 60 s, 1 h = 3600 s, 1 d = 24 h = 86,400 s. Larger units mean smaller numbers.

  • Example: 5000 ms = 5 s
  • Example: 90 min = 1.5 h
  • Tip: h -> s * 3600, s -> h / 3600
speed_info_body:
Speed measures distance per time. Common units are m/s, km/h, mph (miles per hour) and kn (knots, nautical miles per hour).

Relations: 1 m/s = 3.6 km/h. 1 mph is about 1.609 km/h. 1 kn = 1.852 km/h.

  • Example: 10 m/s = 36 km/h
  • Example: 50 km/h is about 13.89 m/s
  • Tip: km/h -> m/s / 3.6
temperature_info_body:
Temperature has three common scales: Celsius (C), Fahrenheit (F) and Kelvin (K). Kelvin is the SI base unit.

Conversions: C -> F: (C x 9/5) + 32. F -> C: (F - 32) x 5/9. C -> K: C + 273.15.

  • Example: 0 C = 32 F
  • Example: 100 C = 373.15 K
  • Tip: K = C + 273.15
volume_info_body:
Volume measures space. Common units are milliliter (ml), liter (l) and cubic meter (m3). 1 l = 1000 ml, 1 m3 = 1000 l.

US gallon (gal) is also common: 1 gal is about 3.785 l.

  • Example: 500 ml = 0.5 l
  • Example: 2 m3 = 2000 l
  • Tip: l -> ml x 1000
energy_info_body:
Energy is measured in joules (J). Common units are kJ, Wh, kWh and kcal.

Relations: 1 kJ = 1000 J. 1 Wh = 3600 J. 1 kWh = 3,600,000 J. 1 kcal is about 4184 J.

  • Example: 1 kWh = 3,600,000 J
  • Example: 5000 J = 5 kJ
  • Tip: Wh -> J x 3600
pressure_info_body:
Pressure is measured in pascals (Pa). Other units are kPa, bar, psi and atm.

Relations: 1 bar = 100,000 Pa. 1 atm = 101,325 Pa. 1 psi is about 6,894.757 Pa.

  • Example: 2 bar = 200,000 Pa
  • Example: 101,325 Pa = 1 atm
  • Tip: bar -> Pa x 100000
currency_info_body:
Currency conversions depend on live exchange rates that change continuously. The same amount can produce different results at different times.

This site uses live rates from an external service. Without an internet connection, currency conversion can't be loaded. For real payments, banks and providers may apply their own rates and fees.

  • Example: 10 EUR -> USD depends on the current rate
  • Tip: Live rates are good for comparisons, but payments can use different rates
intro_text: This converter provides multiple unit categories in a clean, consistent interface. Enter values, choose units, and see results with the calculation steps right away.
overview_text:
• Length, area, and weight for classic SI conversions
  • Time and speed for everyday and technical use
  • Temperature, volume, energy, and pressure for practical needs
  • Currency with live rates (internet required)
